secondary_menu: A pictorial calendar to see the world|a-pictorial-calendar-to-see-the-world

gallery.description:
Migran-t, First skin: Nostalgia. 2021.
Primark flat sheet embroidered with human hair. 
150 x 200 cm.

Detail of bedsheet embroidered with human hair. Belonging to the work Migran-t, the embroidery shows the map of Argentina next to the United Kingdom map with the legend "Nor here, not there" in English and Spanish.

Migran-t: In dreams
Primark pillow covers embroidered with human hair.
2018. Sowing. Performance, 15 minutes. URRA (Tigre, Buenos Aires, Argentina)

Conserve Nº1. Site-specific work conducted by The Triangular Collective in September 2018 in the university community of Santa Fe (Argentina). Performative action of gathering objects from the community and excavation of a hole in the ground for a subsequent ritual burial of these objects.

General view of Conserve Nº2 at Fundación Cazadores. Triangular Collective integrated by Regina Calcaterra, Leonardo Vallejo and Belén Santamarina. The project investigates the seed within a biological, anthropological, historical, social, economic and political context as a platform to imagine the future.
SVM (Seed Vending Machine), 2019. Conserve Nº2 (Seed Capital) · Triangular Collective | Ph. Martina Mordeau.
Chronology Translator, 2019. Conserve Nº2 (Seed Capital) · Triangular Collective | Ph. Martina Mordeau.
Recipes for distance. installation and collective experience. The transcription of the letters in pasta format are sealed and displayed in a cupboard, waiting to be eaten, shared, thrown away.

Consecrated, September - November 2017.  
Intervention n#5, Connection. MARQ (Architecture Museum), City of Buenos Aires, Argentina.
PVC tubes. 26 x 50 cm

Consecrated, September - November 2017.  
Intervention n#4 · In pairs. San Martín Cultural Centre, City of Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Wood, blackboard paint, chalk, rag, string, paper. 40 x 125 cm.
White panties embroidered with human hair lying on the rope in the garden. Belonging to the work My desire is a ghost.

title: Belen Santamarina
footer: Contact: **belenls(at)me.com**. Copyright © 2023 Belen Santamarina. This is an open source website build to be cloned and composted under the GNU GPL. Long live open source!
description: Belen Santamarina, Argentinian visual artist. Lives and works between London and Buenos Aires.
